title: Former Illinois House Speaker Pleads Not Guilty to Racketeering
sub_head: Nation’s longest-serving statehouse speaker faced a yearslong probe into criminal allegations
body:
Former Illinois House Speaker Michael Madigan pleaded not guilty on Wednesday to charges of racketeering conspiracy, bribery, wire fraud and extortion.
Mr. Madigan, 79 years old, was the longest-serving statehouse speaker in U.S. history. The Democratic political power broker led the Illinois’ House for all but two years from 1983 until 2021.
